page.title: 18ITEMS OF NEWS.JAN.-MAY.1985
page.content: {MARCH 14th} OVER 2000 CUSTOMERS IN BALLYMENA WILL HAVE TO INSTALL A NEW WAY OF COOKING AND HEATING IN THEIR HOMES BECAUSE THE TOWN'S LONG-RUNNING GAS SUPPLY WILL BE PHASED OUT OVER THE NEXT TWO-THREE YEARS. THE QUEEN MOTHER WILL VISIT THE ROYAL IRISH RANGERS STATION IN BALLYMENA NEXT WEEK.THIS IS BECAUSE SHE FOUNDED THE STATION IN 1968 AND EACH ST. PATRICKS DAY SHE OR AN ENVOY INSPECTS THE BARRACKS AND TROOPS. {MAY 22nd} A NEW ADDITION IS COMING TO THE BALLYMENA PENNYBRIDGE INDUSTRIAL ESTATE.THE WORK BEGINS IN THE LATE SUMMER AND WILL COST AN ESTIMATED Â£750000 TO CONSTRUCT.IT WILL OCCUPY THE SITE OF THE OLD ELECTRICTY BOARD YARD.THE COMPLEX WILL COVER 13750cm2 COMPLETE WITH A LARGE CARPARK.
